
## Comparable Company Method: Unlever and Relever Beta

```{r}
#| eval: true
#| results: asis
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
library(webexercises)

# Randomized comparable and target structures
set.seed(NULL)
beta_comp <- round(rnorm(1, mean = 1.20, sd = 0.15), 2)
DE_comp <- round(runif(1, min = 0.20, max = 0.60), 2)
tax <- round(runif(1, min = 0.20, max = 0.35), 2)
DE_target <- round(runif(1, min = 0.50, max = 1.00), 2)

beta_unlev <- beta_comp / (1 + (1 - tax) * DE_comp)
beta_rel <- beta_unlev * (1 + (1 - tax) * DE_target)

beta_unlev_disp <- round(beta_unlev, 2)
beta_rel_disp <- round(beta_rel, 2)
```

A comparable firm has **β = `r beta_comp`**, **D/E = `r DE_comp`**, **tax = `r round(100*tax,2)`**%.  
**(a)** Compute the **unlevered beta** for the business.

::: {.question-block}
<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault();" style="display: flex; flex-direction: row; gap: 6px;">
  <label for="module4_num_q4a"><strong>1. Unlevered beta (no units):</strong></label>
  <input type="number" id="module4_num_q4a" name="module4_num_q4a" placeholder="Enter value" style="width: 150px;"
         data-correct-answer=`r beta_unlev_disp` data-tolerance="0.1" />
</form>

<div id="feedback-module4_num_q4a" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
✅ **Step 1 (remove leverage):** β<sub>U</sub> = β<sub>L</sub> / [1 + (1 − T) × (D/E)] → business-only risk.  
**Your numbers:** `r beta_comp` / [1 + (1 − `r tax`) × `r DE_comp`] = **`r beta_unlev_disp`**.
</div>
:::

**(b)** Your **target firm** will finance the project at **D/E = `r DE_target`**. Compute the **relevered beta** to be used in CAPM.

::: {.question-block}
<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault();" style="display: flex; flex-direction: row; gap: 6px;">
  <label for="module4_num_q4b"><strong>2. Relevered beta (no units):</strong></label>
  <input type="number" id="module4_num_q4b" name="module4_num_q4b" placeholder="Enter value" style="width: 150px;"
         data-correct-answer=`r beta_rel_disp` data-tolerance="0.1" />
</form>

<div id="feedback-module4_num_q4b" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
✅ **Step 2 (apply target leverage):** β<sub>L</sub> = β<sub>U</sub> × [1 + (1 − T) × (D/E)].  
**Your numbers:** `r round(beta_unlev,4)` × [1 + (1 − `r tax`) × `r DE_target`] = **`r beta_rel_disp`**.  
This aligns the project’s risk with **your capital structure**.
</div>
:::
